Uses of Class
learning.unsupervised.evaluation.quality.ClusteringQualityIndex

  • Packages that use ClusteringQualityIndex 
    Package Description
    learning.unsupervised.evaluation.quality  

    • Uses of ClusteringQualityIndex in learning.unsupervised.evaluation.quality

      Subclasses of ClusteringQualityIndex in learning.unsupervised.evaluation.quality 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  QIndexCalinskiHarabasz
      This class implements the Calinski-Harabasz clustering quality index, that is based on a variance ratio between inter-cluster and intra-cluster variances.
      class  QIndexCIndex
      This class implements a complement of the C index that was introduced by Hubert and Schultz in 1976 - so that we have "the higher the better", as in other quality indices.
      class  QIndexCRootK
      This class implements the C root k index, that measures the root ratio between average inter-cluster and total feature variances.
      class  QIndexDaviesBouldin
      Davies-Bouldin index is a sum of maximized inter-cluster ratios of cumulative dispersion over inter-cluster distance.
      class  QIndexDunn
      Dunn index is the ratio of the smallest inter-cluster distance and the maximum cluster diameter.
      class  QIndexFolkesMallows
      This class implements the Folkes-Mallows index for estimating clustering quality.
      class  QIndexGoodmanKruskal
      It calculates an index which measures how concordant are the distances with respect to data clusters.
      class  QIndexGPlusComplement
      This class implements the G+ clustering quality index.
      class  QIndexHubertsStatistic
      This class implements the Hubert's G statistic for internal clustering evaluation.
      class  QIndexIsolation
      Isolation index was defined by Pauwels and Frederix in 1999 as the average proportion of elements in k-nearest neighbor sets that are in the same cluster as the point itself.
      class  QIndexJaccard
      Jaccard index is defined as: A / A + B + C where: A = Number of pairs of points in same cluster with same labels; B = Number of pairs of points in same cluster with different labels; C = Number of pairs of points in different clusters with same labels;
      class  QIndexMcClainRao
      This class implements the McClain-Rao clustering configuration quality index.
      class  QIndexPBM
      This class implements the commonly used PBM clustering quality index, which was first proposed in the paper titled: 'Validity Index for Crisp and Fuzzy Clusters', which was published in Pattern Recognition in 2004 and authored by Malay K.
      class  QIndexPointBiserial
      This class implements the point-biserial clustering quality index.
      class  QIndexRand
      a + d / a + b + c + d a = in same cluster with same labels b = in same cluster with different labels c = in different clusters with same labels d = in different cluster with different labels labels are assumed to be given in instance category fields, clustering in clusterAssociations array can also be used to compare the similarity between two cluster configurations, used for stability testing.
      class  QIndexRS
      An implementation of the R squared clustering configuration quality index.
      class  QIndexSD
      An implementation of the SD clustering clusteringConfiguration quality index.
      class  QIndexSilhouette
      Assigns an index value close to 1 to the good configurations and a value close to -1 to the bad ones.
      class  QIndexSimplifiedSilhouette
      Assigns an index value close to 1 to the good configurations and a value close to -1 to the bad ones.
      class  QIndexTau
      This class implements the Tau clustering quality index that is based on calculating concordant and discordant distance pairs.
